intro: Arthrostemma subtriplinervium, commonly known as the three-veined arthrostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with three prominent veins, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
